intro: Knautia neglecta, commonly known as the mountain knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flower clusters that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Knautia neglecta is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. It is a hardy perennial that thrives in full sun and is relatively low maintenance in garden settings.
